artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Sanoya Tomigorō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 183.3; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 42, p. 287.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: one sheet; man seen from back wearing a red loincloth, with blue and red tattoos over back, upper arms, buttocks and thighs, fighting a demon in a mud pit, with blood on his legs and arms, holding a sword in his PR hand; crouching demon in mud, looking up at sword above his head
markings: Artist’s seal: 芳桐 {Yoshikiri} | Carver’s seal: 柳三刀 {Ryūzo tō} | Censor seal: 寅十二改
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Brave Men for the Twenty-eight Lunar Lodges, with Poems (Eimei nijūhasshuku 英名二十八衆句)
signed: 一魁斎芳年筆 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi hitsu}
title: Danshichi Kurobei
